groups.name: Article Naming
groups.description: Requirements related to the naming conventions for articles.

requirements.description: Use the recommended UniProt protein name as the article name if it is relatively short.
requirements.reference: If relatively short, the recommended UniProt protein name should be used as the article name.
requirements.when: Applicable when the protein name is short.

requirements.description: Use a widely used protein acronym or the official HUGO gene symbol if the protein name is verbose.
requirements.reference: If the protein name is verbose, either a widely used protein acronym or the official HUGO gene symbol, followed by '(gene)' if necessary to disambiguate.
requirements.when: Applicable when the protein name is verbose.

requirements.description: Enumerate different members of a protein family with a dash followed by an Arabic number.
requirements.reference: The different members should be enumerated with a dash '-' followed by an Arabic number, e.g. 'desmoglein-1', 'desmoglein-2', etc.
requirements.when: Applicable for proteins grouped into a family.

requirements.description: Include the taxon in the title for viral proteins.
requirements.reference: If the article is about a viral protein, it is recommended to include the taxon in the title.

requirements.description: A parenthesized term added to disambiguate common symbols does not constitute unnecessary disambiguation.
requirements.reference: A parenthesized term added to disambiguate common symbols does not constitute unnecessary disambiguation even when it is the only article with such a name.
